column1: Linteris grew up in Demarest, New Jersey, where he attended Northern Valley Regional High School at Demarest.
Linteris is a member of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Physical Society, the Combustion Institute and Sigma Xi.
He has over 100 publications in the areas of combustion, chemical kinetics, spectroscopy, and heat transfer.
Linteris was a payload specialist on STS-83 (April 4-8, 1997) and STS-94 (July 1-17, 1997) and logged over 471 hours in space.
STS-94 was a re-flight of the Microgravity Science Laboratory (MSL-1) Spacelab mission, and focused on materials and combustion science research in microgravity.
